page.title: 08STOVER PARK HEATHFIELD
page.content: Stover Country Park is owned by{Devon {County Council.}It was opened to the public in 1980. The ground covered by the park is 114 acres;14 of which is a lake. The rest of the ground is covered by woodland. The lake was created in the 18th century by the{ {Templar Family},who also built a Country house on the site of the park; which is now a school. They made their money by transporting {Dartmoor {Granite}from Dartmoor along a granite tramway to Teignmouth.The park is a special conservation area because of the rare species of{Dragonflies}to be found there. On the lake there are many different breeds of water birds including: moorhens, mallards,mute swans and ducks. Fish in the lake are Rudd, Roach, Tench and a few Eels. The park is now a leisure area for{ {walking,fishing}and{picnicking.
